ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I developed a greater awareness of the economic dynamics underlying e-commerce transactions, and how the rise of internet markets will reshape the most fundamental forms of human interaction.
I learnt how internet markets work and how to model a pricing analysis for a website

We applied concepts solidified in earlier economic classes to interesting real-world cases, examining internet marketplaces (Facebook, Uber etc), algorithms, and the ramifications of the digital era more broadly.
Economic principles relating to the internet / web
Research, how to formulate economic theory, extended economic theory, economic policy

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I would have preferred to receive feedback on my problem sets a little earlier in the semester.
It was a pity that the class was virtual but it was well handled despite this.
I really liked the format of the class -- splitting up the more theoretical economic models of internet markets from the current policy debates on anti-trust / etc.
This class was really interesting but the 2 hour lesson over zoom was sometimes hard to get through. I think this class could be improved by meeting 2x per week instead of one long lesson
It was overall a great course. I really enjoyed the material. The theory was challenging but very interesting in conjunction with the studies we read.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Professor Hodgson did a great job of engaging students with the course.
Zoom was alright, perhaps some break out room discussion could have worked well
Since the class was a small seminar, I think it worked really well over zoom.
Zoom worked fine
The grading on problem sets was too lagged to make improvements, but there was not a lot of carry over in the content or an exam so it was fine moreover.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: great course, very interesting material
I would recommend this course to another student. I feel like I learned a lot about the economics of internet markets over the course of the semester.
Yes great senior econ seminar that makes the requirements worthwhile, I used many skills form previous classes
Yes -- such a cool economics senior seminar! You learn about real-world topics and apply knowledge from earlier introductory / intermediate courses.
Yes! Very interesting and engaging Econ senior seminar, especially as this is a topic that is becoming more and more relevant
yes very interesting and a great teacher
Yes, its a good senior seminar for economics
Yes it was a very interesting course of applied economic theory in a field that continues to evolve. The final assignment was particularly engaging.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: It was a weekly zoom seminar
Virtual seminar 1x per week
N/a
